website_summaries.verdict: This first-rate emergency radio offers a terrific combination of durability and affordability.
pros: Comes with 19 pre-set channels, ensuring you can use the radio out of the box
Includes a hand strap to help you carry the radio anywhere you go
Equipped with a backlit LED display that is bright and simple to read
Features a built-in speaker and clock that are sure to serve you well
cons: Battery life leaves much to be desired

customer_reviews.title: Well I loved the radio but it did not last to long
customer_reviews.text: Well I loved the radio but it did not last to long. After a year of limited use, it would not charge or work at all, even if plugged in. I thought the battery was bad so I ordered new replacement batteries. They came charged and the radio did work again, until the battery died. Would not charge via the crank, solar or plugged in. This is a major flaw in that the radio becomes useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: battery is junk
customer_reviews.text: the radio is overpriced to begin with, but the crap battery dying in a couple of months really makes this thing worthless. all the chuckleheads who think the the availability of sangean batteries or aftermarket batteries makes everything okay are failing to consider that this thing should not be smoking the batteries in sixty days in the first place. the fact that the ac adapter is an optional part makes this an even more useless piece of garbage. proprietary or scarcely available batteries are absolutely inappropriate for anything meant for emergency preparedness. this pos is going downrange – it's a nice bright color, should be fine for iron sights at 200 yards.
customer_reviews.author: robert davis

customer_reviews.title: Not working at all after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in our emergency supplies. Got it out to make sure it was charged (after 3 months). It wasn't so I charged it and NONE of the features work. Can only get the weather band to show and it will not change tuning or play. No other bands even available. Useless brick at this point. I am past the return time so will try to make Sangean make good.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska reader

customer_reviews.title: SMARTEST DECISION I MADE -- THIS IS AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I do not write reviews. I am TOO BUSY. But this product is the BEST home run product and I am thrilled. The sound quality is crystal clear and LOUD from across the room. It charges by being in the windowsill. I went through hurricane Irma and wished I had it then. I am prepared now. This is not a flimsy junk product.This is solid and meant to last. THIS IS THE ONE TO GET. I live in Florida and do not represent the product...I am a real dude telling you ...pull the trigger on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joyboyfl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little hiking companion
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few weeks ago and I have to say that the speaker quality is really good. I love the fact that you can charge it multiple ways ( hand crank or solar) it last a long time and have had no issues with it. I just wish it had more mounting options on my pack to make sure it catches the sun while hiking but I'm sure I'll figure something out. So far, very pleased with this item. Small, lightweight and very portable. Plus it helps keep the bears away.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny M

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these in 6 months.. The on/off switch went bad on both. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: marinevet

customer_reviews.title: Not Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, I've dropped it several times. In town picks up most stations. Camping picks up a few. That's why I purchased this. It's plays for several hours on a full charge. I take it around with me at my job. Ive done both, plug it into the wall to charge and sometimes I leave it out side in the full sun. Doesn't take long. I have not tried to charge a cell phone with it yet so I can't speak on that. Great flashlight on the end, and a emergency flasher ( I haven't used really) I keep one in the trunk of our cars.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal

customer_reviews.title: A well-made, functional radio
customer_reviews.text: I don't think pictures do this justice. This is a sturdy, well made radio that is far more rugged than you'd think from the pictures. Lots of ways to charge the provide the imr 18350 type battery. Sounds is far better than it has a right to be, and the sensitivity on FM and weather bands is outstanding. AM appears to be okay although I didn't test it extensively. You can set it to your best weather channel and then put it in standby mode in case an alert is broadcast. That sound is loud and will wake you. Highly recommended for areas that get weather or for when you're camping.
customer_reviews.author: TomK1

customer_reviews.title: I trust my Family’s  welfare to this radio!
customer_reviews.text: Saved us tonight! This radio sounded the alarm a good 2 min before the sirens went off and 3 min before our local TV station mentioned the tornado warning. Living close the state lines it also goes off for neighboring counties even in another state. Since all weather usually hits there first this is helpful. It holds a good charge and is very reliable. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W Fryer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! We bought it for a future overland trip through Central and South America, but I've known for years we should have something like this for natural disasters too. Specifically, I love the option of the hand crank (easy) or solar power and that it creates enough power to charge my smartphone when the electricity is out for days. The speaker is fine and I'm listening to music while I type. The reception is good.It seems very durable and solid. All in all, a great purchase that I would easily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, everything checks out fine. The digital tuner is a welcome addition instead of fumbling with a rotary dial that wont stay on frequency. Like others have noted, if you want weather alerts that's all it will do until you change to another mode. Without actually hooking up the battery and testing it I cannot comment on the quality of it, but I suspect it would be prudent to get a new one of better quality just in case and leave this one for backup. It is an EMERGENCY radio, as such it fills that role well.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H

customer_reviews.title: Tried many multiple energy weather radios - this is it!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a reliable weather radio with Weather Alert, FM/AM, and source of battery power for electronics. Sangean makes high quality radios (search for their other units). Many other products are poor quality, break within days of use, or have major problems. This Sangean unit is High Quality : digital tuning and controls (not the cheaply made, difficult to tune dials), multiple power sources that work well (Solar, Crank dynamo, USB), good sound quality, LED with safety SOS light/sound alarm, replaceable and rechargeable battery, water resistance and perfect manual (a rarity these days). Would give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: basement doc

customer_reviews.title: Will not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this weather radio for additional peace of mind while spending time at my rural property, which gets no TV reception. The first thing that impressed me, before I ever turned it on, was the quality construction and feel of this radio. The reception is amazing and I like the digital tuner. The alternate power sources (crank and solar) are nice features to have in an emergency as well. If you want a quality weather radio that has it all then order this bad boy, you won't be disappointed. 5 Stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Tex

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Cute. Small. Thus easy to keep handy. We lost power last year with hurricane Mathew for over 15 days. Wanted something I could recharge in dire circumstances. This fits that. It has not come on to warn me of imminent bad weather. So not overly sensitive. I gave it five stars because of function. I wanted to charge it up and leave it for emergencies and then recharge it during power outages. It does not hold a charge. I guess monitoring the weather runs it down. So when bad weather hits it will be dead OR I got the news ahead of time and charged it up. Reception and clarity or good.
customer_reviews.author: Les Leary

customer_reviews.title: Better than Brand E!
customer_reviews.text: I love it - so much better that the Eton alternatives. I have two of the predecessor MMR-77's, but they lack the Li-ion battery, cell phone charging, solar power, and digital tuning found on this model. Although the MMR-88 is bulkier and heavier than its predecessor, it is still a reasonable size and has a VERY sturdy feel (unlike the aforementioned Etons).
customer_reviews.author: David L. Gilmer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: i BOUGHT THIS RADIO A LITTLE OVER 3 M. AGO, WE USED IT ONCE FOR ABOUT AN HOUR A HALF. WE TRIED TO USE IT AGAIN A COUPLE OF DAYS AGO, CHARGED IT FOR 6 HOURS, THE RADIO IS DEAD!! AT THIS POINT WE CAN'T EVEN RETURN IT, BECAUSE WE BOUGHT IT OVER A M AGO. I NEED TO EDIT MY REVIEW. I CONTACTED SANGEAN AND THEY WILL FIX THE PROBLEM-WHAT EVER IT IS, FREE OF CHARGE. I GIVE THEM A 5*
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: not very good in a emergency
customer_reviews.text: bought this for emergency use, was using as a portable radio which it works OK for..but when needed to use when we lost power, it would not charge a i phone or Samsung .. cranked until exhausted and could only get one bar on radio battery and never charged phones..makes a OK portable radio and that is about it..would not recommend for a emergency..DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Plays the weather channels perfectly. Works great for listening to FM radio while working on the car, while camping, and around the home. I have used mine for several years now. I do not really listen to AM so I cannot speak for that capability. I can get it to charge off the solar panel although the wall charger goes much faster. I tried using it to charge cell phones while camping using the radio's solar panel and the hand crank but did not get too far on my high-drain device. The flashlight functionality is useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jershon Eagar

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This radio is a great value, delivered as promised. It charged quickly with AC power (have yet to try solar because it's been raining a lot and I can't bear to part with it while I'm tinkering in my garage)! Great reception, awesome sound, durable quality, easy-to-follow instructions, super portable size and weight --- we've taken a road trip already --- but it's a mighty little thing. Everyone should have one of these for preparedness.
customer_reviews.author: KC|

customer_reviews.title: A Little Gem
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction as described by other reviewers ... and good reception ... surprising audio quality sufficient for everyday use, from a small speaker. I also replaced the standard battery with an AW brand battery with the same specs, to ensure long-term optimal performance. Note that this is NOT quite a pocket radio ... it's size and stability where it gets placed do contribute to its convenient use. No regrets with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mavn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible performance!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio a year ago... It's basically dead. Solar never worked at all. Crank is limited and doesn't wind smoothly now. I barely ever used the crank anyway so that wasn't a big issue for me. Main problem is it never held a charge for more then 3 or 4 hrs after the first 3 months of use and continued to get worse. I just ordered replacement batteries for it but I wasted my money because it doesn't charge at all now. Doen't matter what battery is in there! TOTALLY disappointed in this radio and feel like I got completely ripped off! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: michael seminario

customer_reviews.title: Very top line emergency radio.  Sangean makes amazing high quality radios.
customer_reviews.text: Having bought several Sangean radios for decades, they have the best quality, features, and sound for every type. This is no exception. Rugged and water resistant yet easy to carry by the strap. So many extra features that make it a must for the home, camping, or any emergency. 5v. USB jack is great for charging phones, flashlights, lanterns, other devices by solar cell or hand crank. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mr engineer

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! We camp off grid quite a bit, and this has made it possible to still get a little NPR and music in my life when we are in the boonies. Right now we have our RV parked in a shady spot, so I can't listen for as long before I have to wind the thing, but it's got a good sound and it's not hard to find our favorite stations. The flash light is great, and even though I'm not good at cranking the thing, I love it that this is an option.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Shenk

customer_reviews.title: A Great Portable Radio !
customer_reviews.text: We love this little radio...we haven't used it way out in the woods camping or hiking yet but we take it kayaking with us.Well I was turned over in my kayak the other day at the dock where it was quite rough and this little radio went completely under water .Water was in every part of it .It stopped working immediately but we took a hair drier an dried it out completely.Bam it start working again.It completely charged up again. All lights and the radio are working great.The sound is great.I highly recommend this little portable radio .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa a Greer

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sketchy at best. Sometimes it charges and sometimes it looks like it's charging/charged but shows low battery the moment you unplug it and try to turn it on. If I wiggle the USB2 cable even slightly, the charge light flickers or goes out altogether. Doesn't exactly leave you feeling like you're gonna be covered during an emergency. The sound is good. That's about all I can say for it.
customer_reviews.author: Scagnetti

customer_reviews.title: THIS RADIO AND ALERT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this radio yesterday, and set it up. It took a while to set it up; but, we had a tornado weather alert today, and it came on and gave me the alert and worked properly. I WAS IMPRESSED! I was also satisfied that I could get the main channels I liked in our building, because it's a steel building, and sometimes difficult to get reception on some things. The instructions didn't answer some of my questions, but, it seems to be doing what it's supposed to do, so I guess I got it set up correctly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Washburn

customer_reviews.title: It does what we need!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a remote location in the Chattahoochee National Forest. Although, that may not be your cup of tea, we love it here. Having a NOAA weather alert radio is very much appreciated. It is one of those items everyone assumes they'll need until they need it. In addition, local NOAA is the best weather available.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me safe and informed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to discover that this radio does NOT come with an AC adaptor. However, a week after I received it we experienced severe weather in SWFL. I put the battery in the radio, set the Weather Alert and I was kept up-to-date on tornado warnings throughout the day. It did exactly what I wanted and needed to stay safe and informed. Now....I need to find the right plug :)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Features
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reception & sound. Seems to be well built. Have yet to listen more than 3 hrs at one time so I'm not sure how long a full charge will last but I did find that it recharges quite fast (using a mini USB connected to my Desk-top PC). Have yet to use the hand crank for charging. No problems with provided chargeable battery (yet?).
customer_reviews.author: P. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: I always like Sangean products. This emergency radio is no exception. The radio can be charged in three ways. First, using the solar panel on the top. Only a small amount of sunlight is needed to start charging it. The second method is to use the hand crank on the back. The third method is to charge it from your computer using the included cable. You cannot go wrong with this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F From Durham NC

customer_reviews.title: A great design - great reception perf even in fringe area.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have had perfect success with all models of Sangeon Radios. This one seems to perform well too, in fact for such a compact design with so many features it is fantastic! It is heavy-duty with great reception (I only use for FM). I gave one as a gift and heard back that it is the best radio he has. Just leave it in a window and it stays charged fine. I have one at work, one at home, and one in my car. About the only caution is to be careful with the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable radio
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio for my digital media detox. Radio is well built with long antenna, backlit screen with clock. It also comes with several charging options (USB, Solar and Dynamo). Sound is good and loud. Flash light (blinker and SOS morse code selection) is good enough for the dark, short distances. Portable fits in a bag, can also charge small devices. This is an excellent emergency / daily use radio. Love it. Highly recommended. Note: Works in the Philippines, AM/FM frequencies no problem, WX alert for US only. For AM change the tuning step from 10 to 9 to get the AM stations right. (see manual),.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Emerson Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Did a little research and found this one to be one of the most liked and the price was right so I ordered it. The receiver is great, I have had other portable radios that had trouble picking up a favorite station from a neighboring city, this one picks it up solid. Seems well built. I really wish it was powered by an 18650 battery instead of the 18350 but I’ll buy a couple more and keep them with the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Bizzell

customer_reviews.title: Poor manual, siren cannot be activated for alerts
customer_reviews.text: Sangean MMR-88 instruction manual is lacking basic info on how to program S.A.M.E. technology. Also, I cannot setup the Emergency Alert setting (“Activating the Weather Alert” on page 15 in manual) because when you follow those steps NO SIREN SOUNDS. The siren does work, that much is certain because you can hear it, but you would need to Activate my alerts so that the radio could sound the siren if you do get a Public Alert. I returned this item back for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: MCB

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: probably the radio reviews are not bad, but for some reason I came with an idle sound ...
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Derevyanko

customer_reviews.title: if you only own one radio, this is the one
customer_reviews.text: I am a general class ham radio operator and a Biomed electronics tech. I can say this is a very high quality radio. great in every way. only the C Crane radio can beat it. Buy it ! i use it all the time, great with its 90 minute sleep time to listen to talk radio at night. the solar charger and light work well.
customer_reviews.author: scot m

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio for use during threatnening weather.
customer_reviews.text: As with most Sangean products I've owned, the MMR-88 performs very and the quality is very high. The radio is a bit smaller than I had imagined from the pictures, but the audio sounds like a much larger radio. I bought it as an emergency radio to use during threatening weather......not as a daily 24hr. weather alert radio. The MMR-88 gives me access to the local am/fm stations during power outages when TV is not available. This actually happen to us a few months ago when frequent severe storms were occurring in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: An "Extremely Versatile and Practical" Christmas gift for our son ...
customer_reviews.text: An "Extremely Versatile and Practical" Christmas gift for our son. When not in use; we suggested he store it (as we do) in the corner of a SW facing window ledge where it is Readily Available & Constantly Recharged with the Solar function. The multi-band (AM/FM/7 Wx Bands/2 SW) radio with 3-way lite system. Recharges via; Solar, Hand Crank, attachable power UBS cord, rechargeable battery and replaceable AA back-up. Really Important; You can back-charge your cell phones "off" the radio batteries. [I bought a 2nd radio for our 8 yr. old Grandson as well..]
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Price

customer_reviews.title: Awesome radio.
customer_reviews.text: This light is good. The sound isn't bad either. I have extra 18350 batteries for it. But the runtime is pretty good. The preset feature is a little challenging. Very durable feeling. The usb output will only charge a cell phone at a slow rate. Will also charge in sun or hand crank.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY PORTO

customer_reviews.title: Performs just as I hoped it would.
customer_reviews.text: I put much thought into this purchase before deciding on the Sangean MMR-88. During the last power outage, I realized how out of touch and isolated we felt and decided to add a couple of items to my hurricane kit. This unit was the right balance of price and performance. I definitely wanted digital tuning, and having a battery that can be replaced also appealed to me. I'm happy with my purchase, it has performed as I hoped it would. I have briefly tested both the hand crank and the solar panel, and they both were charging as they should. I am pleased with my purchase and feel a little more prepared for the next power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Great small radio.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sangean radio purchase. I'm impressed with how well made they are. The MMR-88 has a very "Big" sound for such a small radio. It charges off a USB cable and "tops up" with a small solar panel on the top. It runs for several days per charge for me. Way better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chester J Flynn

customer_reviews.title: don’t know
customer_reviews.text: had a sangean weather radio for many years this one I have yet to hear weather alert but get them over my phone set it up according to instructions same as old radio says wx alert on display but does not go off also once wx is set radio cannot be used to you cancel the weather alert setting not like my original
customer_reviews.author: ryan r. mensing

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the sound quality. Reasonable reception. Leave on windowsill in kitchen and rarely needs to be plugged in to charge. I have one and have given 3 as gifts so far. Rechargeable battery could be easily replaced if wears out. Solar panel works well.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, solar keeps it going
customer_reviews.text: This little radio stays continuously charged by sitting in the kitchen window (southern exposure). I only charged it one time when were were listening to it several hours each day and the solar could not keep up after a week or so. The sound quality is remarkable - clearly they used a quality speaker. The memory system (preset stations) is a bit convoluted for me, but the instruction are accurate - set and forget.
customer_reviews.author: pje

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more happy, I have had this kind of radio before and could not pick up any local stations. But this radio picks them all up. I lose power all winter long and now i will at least be able to get local info and music , I love that it is small and has great features. I think this would be a great gift for the campers in you life.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Nice emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these for the wife, and two kids at college. Did a lot of 'research' into which radio to get that has the weather alert feature, and multiple means of power. I went with these, and so far they are doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great all around radioto
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for emergencies and it sat in a closet for a year. One day I took it outside while i was painting the deck and was amazed how well it sounds and that it gets AM stations with very little static. Now it goes everywhere with me. It will last for hours on a full charge and if it dies, it doesn't take many turns of the built-in handle to get another hour out of it. I keep it in my workshop now and just plug it in at the end of the day to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: frator

customer_reviews.title: I love this radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is great for getting ready in the morning listening to music or the news. I sometimes have to move it around because it gets a bit of static. Once I find the sweet spot, it's crystal clear. It's very solid. I will be taking it camping this summer.
customer_reviews.author: cbear

customer_reviews.title: For me it's a good toll, but batterie life is too
customer_reviews.text: For me it's a good toll , but batterie life is too short
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Battery seems a little too small. Will not play all day without recharging. Has good reception and sound quality is great. But set up can be frustrating and I had to refer to the user manual on several occasions which to me is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt J. Luttenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely impressed with the engineering of a Sangean FM table radio I bought my mom some years ago - both it's ability to get weak stations in a rural area and its audio quality. So, even though some of the reviews of this Sangean emergency radio were so-so, I decided to go with my gut. Good choice. I'm impressed with this radio too. Good reception, good audio quality, and easy to cary around. And, although a number of reviewer said the batter that came with it was worthless, mine has been great. It keeps its charge just fine. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Avogadro

customer_reviews.title: Handy portable radio
customer_reviews.text: Cute little radio with lots of features. I actually use it for my dog outside when she is chilling in her dog pen. But it's perfect for taking anywhere. Reception is good and it picks up many stations.
customer_reviews.author: Leon L.

customer_reviews.title: E Error after only a few months. Unusable now.
customer_reviews.text: Leave in the sun all day, and 'E' appears on the LCD. Won't turn on, none of the buttons respond. I thought this was a good brand, but everyone says its not. Expensive for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Endrago

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened my radio and no lithium battery was included. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: pat henry

customer_reviews.title: Great for beside the Pool
customer_reviews.text: I got this a month ago and its been sitting beside my pool since. Its been though storms and rain without effecting. Its always charged due to solar panel on the top. It has a nice sound for the price.
customer_reviews.author: rose brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio!
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. Good sound for its' size, gets the hard to receive stations. Easy operation. I have bought slightly cheaper radios with the same feature but they were junk and were returned. Also had more expensive products that were very complicated to use and failed. So far this is a big jump up in quality from the $30-40 radios with the same features.
customer_reviews.author: ClareAnn J.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Well thought-out, and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and worked perfectly. I use it for the clock on my desk, but in an emergency, it has the emergency weather warning channel, a flashlight mode, and AM-FM. Plus, it has a solar charger and hand-crank charger to charge your phones. I haven't tried the siren yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this one might be for you. Small and portable, has a nice look about it. Could not get the local AM/FM stations to come in without static.Was trying it in the garage, still think it should have come in better. Sent it back mainly because I'm trying to stay with AA/AAA batteries if possible.
customer_reviews.author: SCW

customer_reviews.title: Non techinical review.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-constructed, pack full of features, nice size radio. Every family should have one of these. Outdoor enthusiasts would really benefit. Would be great for vehicles. Yeah I really like it and recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E. Sowers

customer_reviews.title: This is quite a nice radio. I was pleasantly surprised by it's apparent ...
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a nice radio. I was pleasantly surprised by it's apparent quality for the money. I live in a tough area for FM signals but the sensitivity of this radio allows for excellent reception. It's easy to set up and use and should prove to be an excellent emergency radio as well as for everyday use. It's compact and light, the display is excellent, the buttons work well, and it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Informed_Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Low volume
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the unit is worked very good. Now, at full volume I can't hardly hear it across the room. If you are not using in a small quiet area do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cone

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for the power to go out.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed it yet but nice and light weight. Wish it had a reading light and a cord to plug into a wall outlet to recharge. Most likely will purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Charging
customer_reviews.text: Stopped charging. The charging cord won’t stay inserted comes loose. This happened right after the expiration return date of 10/28/18, how convenient!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Sweet....
customer_reviews.text: When your power goes out you'll be glad you've got this little gem. Charges your cell phones too!
customer_reviews.author: M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Solar cell is more for show than for function
customer_reviews.text: The weather alarm is loud enough to wake the dead, and the solar cell is more for show than for function.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't set up the radio -- the buttons on the front of the unit would not function properly. Returned for an immediate credit to my Amazon account.
customer_reviews.author: John H. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It's not a Bose but, perfect for my boat. I like that the sun charges it if I forget to. Super compact and fits in my boats glove box. It picks up stations very well. For it's small size it sounds pretty good. I absolutely recommend this radio for convenience and on the go use.
customer_reviews.author: scotti509

customer_reviews.title: great radio
customer_reviews.text: nice little radio works great had a little trouble setting the presets but i only purchased this for emergencies but it works so good i find myself using everyday ! great price also!
customer_reviews.author: darrin durrell

customer_reviews.title: 10 OUT OF 10, BEST SOUND & RECEPTION
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid little radio. The reception is very good and the sound is comparable to a much bigger and more expensive radio, not tinny at all but full and rich. I use it every morning and love it. If you a appreciate good reception and great sound then you can't go past it. I charged it in the sun from 1 bar and it reached 4 bars ( fully charged )in around 6 hours, but using my normal phone charger was very fast. Haven't used all the features yet accept channel presets but just LOVE it. 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, light weight, great for emergencies and weather alerts
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this radio. Haven't fully tested the crank and solar but the rest works great - easy to program. Reasonable sound quality. I bought it as an emergency radio to get weather alerts, local announcements, etc. but also enjoy listening to it at my home desk. The station pre-programming is easy to do and works great. I wasn't really thrilled that it came in yellow, but now that I've seen it I don't mind at all - cute and I like the small footprint - very light weight so will be easy to carry if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Just a all around great radio. Great sound quality for a emergency radio! It picks up the weather stations like no other radio that I have, I’m picking up far off stations. Just great!
customer_reviews.author: Rob King

customer_reviews.title: Sangean MMR-88 - Great Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: After some research I decided on this emergency radio. It is a good fit for my household because of the charging features. It's size is portable but may be a bit large for hiking or primitive camping trips. It picks up several weather channels in my area as well as many FM stations. The AM tuner didn't pick up many stations but I can deal with that. I'm quite satisfied thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant capabilities - excellent for emergency preparedness
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for every member of my family, and have shared info with every one of my clients. This is an excellent product. Brilliant design and capabilities. Well built. Compact. Very impressed. With recent major weather and fire events, this is an important part of any emergency preparedness.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: A nice little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little radio. The sound is surprisingly good, it's easy to program, there are multiple ways to charge it up, and the output port can be used to charge a phone or run a USB-powered device.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Average Radio
customer_reviews.text: You pay more and get what you pay for... I listen AM especially at night. Big difference in strength of signal, sound quality, available stations, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Phyl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful - Exactly as advertised. Well built, good sound and very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Wanchaiman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic radio, incredible AM reception, Great build quality, highly recommend, this is a great radio
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Seems a fine product
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any emergency to really test this product. However, I have checked it out and put it through its paces and it seems fine to me. I see nothing to complain of. I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: It won't accept batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little radio. The only thing I would like better is if it would hold regular batteries. If you need a radio to run for days during a power outage you can't recharge. Otherwise a great radio
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Marie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good radio, but...
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit for my restroom, but it way too small for my needs. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Love this radio
customer_reviews.text: Great radio,I bought this along with the midland ER310,in my opinion the sangean is much better radio.Has great sound out of a small package.I gave the midland to my sister for Christmas and she likes it fine.
customer_reviews.author: larry bales

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: Seems to hold charge well...in the mountains, had trouble getting many stations so not sure if an additional antennae would help.
customer_reviews.author: CLA

customer_reviews.title: Super durable build and surprisingly powerful speaker for such a small, portable radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to listen to the broadcast on the mountain while spectating the Pikes Peak Hill Climb. If the solar panel on the top isn't enough, the hand-crank does a great job of keeping it charged well enough to put out plenty of crystal clear sound out of this perfectly portable little radio. The flashlight on the side comes with 4 modes: steady bright, steady dim, blinking bright and SOS bright. I'd carry this in my backpack on any hiking trip, camping trip, or to go watch the Pikes Peak Hill Climb of course.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift to my “fisherman” and he loves it. He takes it with him on fishing trips.
customer_reviews.author: N Witt

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio!!
customer_reviews.text: I like pretty much everything about this radio. I use it in the yard and take it to the beach and get very good reception. The only issue I had (but figured it out) was how to save preset stations. I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Cries wolf
customer_reviews.text: It does not use the county information provided by NOAA so the alarm goes off for any weather alert issued for my state. This means that most of the alarms are not relevant for my location.
customer_reviews.author: frataquinol

customer_reviews.title: For it size
customer_reviews.text: For a compact radio the sound quality is quite good. Having the hand crank does come in handy as the batteries wear down. I am pleased with this radio but it would be nice if it had a carry strap so as to help when carrying it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Star

customer_reviews.title: Battery is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for two years as of 2020. Battery is terrible. It’s an atypical rechargeable size and hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Redblack86

customer_reviews.title: I cannot review this item...
customer_reviews.text: ....as I bought this for someone else but she tells me it's great and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good, loud, and useful in daily life.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly loud. We use this as a kitchen radio and for earthquake disaster prep, and it has become our default radio for daily use. The digital tuner and station memory is great. Haven't really used the hand crank and solar functions, but for camping they could be handy.
customer_reviews.author: Land Manatee

customer_reviews.title: Great charging options!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our hurricane prep. Had a long battery life and the multiple charging options are excellent. Love having a port I can charge my phone with as well. Very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Nice having a larger solar panel that actually works. The dynamo crank has nice feedback and charges decently fast. Sensitivity and signal strength is average to slightly above average. Love the flashlight and SOS function. This will be my main camping/bugout radio.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ervey

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: This radio sounds good, is small enough to carry with you, and the charging capability, though untested yet, is very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but small battery
customer_reviews.text: The unit is well made, seems high quality, but I can't get past the small battery. Yes you can recharge it but why not use a larger battery for reserve power.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you in the know!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. We camp a lot along the coast and it is great for keeping up with the weather. Plus it picks up all kinds of music stations, especially on the Outer Banks where we camp at least 6 or 7 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: linda wilson

customer_reviews.title: Read Instructs Completely, FIRST!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. A bit cantankerous. CHARGE COMPLETELY FIRST USING AC OR USB ADAPTOR.
customer_reviews.author: B.A. Salt

customer_reviews.title: Sangean sent a new one which was great though my postage to return the old one it ...
customer_reviews.text: The first radio malfunctioned. Sangean sent a new one which was great though my postage to return the old one it was too high- tough call.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio. Compact and solid. Great for voice, but not a boombox. I went ahead and bought another for a gift. Don't hesitate for an emergency radio or every day radio, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: Another great emergency radio for your bug out bag lots of features...
customer_reviews.author: D.Kelly

customer_reviews.title: This works exactly as advertised. The only reason I ...
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars , is because the solar panel will not charge under artificial light , such as a desk lamp.
customer_reviews.author: space cadet

product_meta.title: Sangean MMR-88 AM/FM/Weather+Alert Emergency Radio. Solar/Hand Crank/USB/Flashlight, Siren, Smartphone Charger
feature_bullets: Digital AM/ FM tuner with 19 random preset stations (AM/ FM Mixed) receives all 7 NOAA weather channel and reports
Powered by hand-crank Dynamo/ solar panel/ DC in (micro USB B Type) to rechargeable lithium battery USB a to Micro USB B cable and hand strap included
Illumination Lamp, charging LED indicator, weather alert LED indicator, adjustable LED flashlight (hi, low, blinking, sos Morse code) and emergency buzzer
Built-in clock with optional 90 minute auto shut off, built-in speaker and stereo headphone jack
Dc out（5v/ 0.3A）usb a type Socket for charging your mobile phone or MP3 player, DC in（5v/ 0.5A）micro USB B Type Socket for charging

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars767 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
